1: A friend's frown is better than a fool's smile.
2: A friend in need is a friend indeed.
3: A friend is easier lost than found.
4: A friend to everybody is a friend to nobody.
5: A problem shared is a problem halved.
6: A true friend is someone who reaches for your hand, but touches your heart.
7: False friends are worse than open enemies.
8: Flattery is all right so long as you don't inhale.
9: Give credit where credit is due.
11: Memory is the treasure of the mind.
12: Nothing dries sooner than a tear.
13: Old friends and old wine are best.
14: The best of friends must part.
15: The best things are not bought and sold.
16: There is no better looking-glass than an old friend.
17: To err is human (To forgive divine).
18: Two cannot fall out if one does not choose.
19: A loveless life is a living death.
20: Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
21: All's fair in love and war.
22: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
23: Before you meet the handsome prince you have to kiss a lot of toads.
24: Better to have loved and lost, than to have never loved at all.
26: Distance makes the heart grow fonder.
27: Faint heart never won fair lady.
28: First impressions are the most lasting.
29: Hatred is as blind as love.
30: Love and a cough cannot be hid.
31: Love does much but money does all.
33: Love makes a good eye squint.
35: Love sought is good, but given unsought is better.
36: Love to live and live to love.
37: Love with life is heaven; and life unloving, hell.
38: Man is the head but woman turns it.
39: Marry in haste, repent at leisure.
40: The course of love never did run smooth.
41: The Lord loveth a cheerful liar.
42: There is a thin line between love and hate.
45: You can't live on bread alone.
46: A good friend is one's nearest relation.
47: A man is known by the company he keeps.
48: A man of straw needs a woman of gold.
49: A wink is as good as a nod, to a blind man.
50: An injury is forgiven better than an injury revenged.
51: Anger and hate hinder good counsel.
53: At a round table there's no dispute about the place.
54: Attack is the best form of defense
55: Be slow in choosing, but slower in changing.
56: Behind every great man stands a strong woman.
58: Cheerfulness smooths the road of life.
60: Conscience makes cowards of us all.
62: Do as you would be done by.
63: Do unto others as you would have them do to you.
64: Grow angry slowly; there's plenty of time.
65: He bears misery best that hides it most.
66: He that hurts another, hurts himself.
67: He who wronged you will hate you.
69: I am rubber and you are glue. Your words bounce off me and stick to you.
70: If you lose your temper, don't look for it.
71: It's not over till it's over.
72: Joy shared is double joy; grief shared is (only) half grief.
73: Laugh and the world laughs with you. Cry and you cry alone.
74: Never let the sun set on angry heart.
75: Never let the sun go down on your anger.
76: Never let the sun set on thy wrath.
77: Never quarrel with one's bread and butter.
78: No man or woman is worth your tears, and the one who is, won't make you cry.
79: Open confession is good for the soul.
80: Out of sight, out of mind.
83: Spare the rod and spoil the child.
84: Temper is so good a thing that we should never lose it.
85: To the world you may be one person, but to one person, you may be the world.
86: Wondrous is the strength of cheerfulness.
87: You made your bed, now you must lie in it.
88: A bully is always a coward.
89: A handsome shoe often pinches the foot.
90: A good thing is all the sweeter when won with pain.
91: A man too careful of danger lives in continual torment.
92: A miss is as good as a mile.
94: Adversity and loss make a man wise
95: All promises are either broken or kept.
96: All things come to those that wait.
97: An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.
98: An open door may tempt a saint.
99: As one door closes, another always opens.
100: As you go through life, make this your goal, watch the doughnut and not the hole.
